required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: First Presentation of Parkinson Disease Patients to Neurologist
clinical_study.official_title: CEE PMSS (Central Eastern European Post-Marketing Surveillance Study) First Presentation of Mirapexin in Parkinson Patients

brief_summary.textblock: In this study information is gathered about the treatment of Parkinson patients who present themselves in a neurological practice for the first time

primary_outcome.measure: Number of De-novo Patients in Whom Monotherapy With Mirapexin® Could be Successfully Initiated
primary_outcome.description: Successful initiation was defined as a clinical assessment of efficacy by the neurologist rated at least as "good" on a 4 point scale after 4-8 weeks Mirapexin® treatment, where:1 = very good; 2 = good; 3 = moderate; and 4 = poor. De-novo patients were identified by: those who were referred: - if 'Reason for Referral' = 'initiation of therapy' or for 'diagnostic reason' and for those not referred: - if initial pharmacotherapy = 'Mirapexin® monotherapy' (i.e., no other anti Parkinson Disease (PD) therapy)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in UPDRS (Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale) Part I
secondary_outcome.description: Change in UPDRS Part I score from baseline to final visit. The score ranging from 0-16 (0= no disability, 16= maximum disability)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in UPDRS Part III
secondary_outcome.description: Change in UPDRS Part III score from baseline to final visit. Score ranging from 0 - 108 (0= no disability, 108 = worst disability).

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Clinical Assessments of Efficacy of Mirapexin® for All Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Successful initiation was defined as a clinical assessment of efficacy by the neurologist rated at least as "good" on a 4 point scale after 4-8 weeks Mirapexin® treatment, where:1 = very good; 2 = good; 3 = moderate; and 4 = poor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Parkinson Disease patients presenting to neurologist for first time
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypersensitivity to the active substance or to any of the excipients

group.title: Mirapexin® (Pramipexole)
group.description: The dose of Mirapexin® was selected by the neurologist upon his/her clinical judgement based on individual patient need and on recommendations given in the Mirapexin® Summary of Product Characteristics. mode of administration (admin.): Tablets for oral use

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Lack of efficacy and patient wish

De-novo patients were identified by: those who were referred: - if ‘Reason for Referral’ = ‘initiation of therapy’ or for ‘diagnostic reason’ and for those not referred: - if initial pharmacotherapy = ‘Mirapexin® monotherapy’ (i.e., no other anti Parkinson Disease (PD) therapy)
outcome.population: Full Analysis set (FAS) of De-novo patients in whom monotherapy with Mirapexin® could be successfully initiated

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
